title: Jennifer Aniston follows ex Justin Theroux on Instagram
text:
Jennifer and Justin are still friendly exes (Picture: FilmMagic)

Jennifer Aniston has finally joined the pandora’s box that is Instagram and, of course, it would be silly not to have a cheeky peek at her follow list.

But it may surprise you to find that the Friends actress has followed her ex-husband Justin Theroux on the platform.

The 50-year-old took the plunge and created an Instagram account on Tuesday and pretty much broke the internet by sharing a reunion photo of the whole Friends cast as her first snap.

If you can take your eyes off the awesome selfie long enough, you’ll realise that Jen is following just 81 people so far.

The usual suspects are all there, including her Hollywood besties Courteney Cox, Lisa Kudrow, Julia Roberts, Kate Hudson, Adam Sandler, Nicole Kidman, Chelsea Handler and Gwyneth Paltrow.

However one name stood out in particular – her ex-husband, Justin.

Jennifer and Justin, 48, broke all our hearts when they split in 2017 after two years of marriage. But clearly, it was an amicable separation and they’re friendly enough for Jen to click that follow button on Justin’s account.

Friends gang’s all here (Picture: Jennifer Aniston, Instagram)

It was suggested that the former spouses were still on good terms when they reunited to mourn the loss of their beloved dog Dolly back in July.

Sharing the heartbreaking news of Dolly’s death, Justin posted a photo of he and a woman believed to be Jennifer holding hands at the pooch’s funeral.

Justin also alluded to Jennifer’s presence at the wake, stating that Dolly was ‘surrounded by her entire family’ at the time of her passing.

The couple have barely spoken about their split publicly but said in their joint announcement that they still had ‘deep respect’ for each other.

‘Normally we would do this privately, but given that the gossip industry cannot resist an opportunity to speculate and invent, we wanted to convey the truth directly.

‘Whatever else is printed about us that is not directly from us, is someone else’s fictional narrative. Above all, we are determined to maintain the deep respect and love that we have for one another.’
